description: This course explores the history, foundational principles, and theory of data visualization. By designing and creating visualizations with a focus on the iterative process, students learn how to clearly and effectively communicate a story with data. The course utilizes multiple forms of visualization, from sketches to static plots to interactive web -based dashboards using professional visualization software. Offered alternate years during spring semester. Prerequisites: SDS 164, SDS 172, AP Statistics, or permission of instructor.
name: Principles of Data Visualization
prerequisites: Prerequisites: SDS 164, SDS 172, AP Statistics, or permission of instructor.
